Mary Bengtson, 87, of Denton, passed away at home surrounded by her family on October 27, 2021. She was born to William and Mary Farrar on August 17, 1934 in Providence, Rhode Island. She married William (Bill) Bengtson on March 20, 1954.

She was a member of the Catholic Daughters of the Americas and was a Girl Scout Leader for 12 years. She was a member of St. Patrick Catholic Church in Dallas for 36 years and is currently a member of Immaculate Conception Catholic Church of Denton.

There will be a visitation and Rosary held at DeBerry Funeral Directors in Denton on Wednesday, November 3, 2021 from 5:00 to 7:00 p.m..

She is likely pleased that her death occurred on the same day as her mother 35 years earlier..
Not long after the move however, Charlene lost her baby brother, Roger...a tragedy that impacted the family's early years in a new home in a new state so far from relatives and friends..
Both sets of parents discouraged a college wedding, not due to their choice of spouses, but because they knew how tough it would be for two "kids" to have an enduring marriage..
Both Charlene and Gordon were only 19 years old, but they persevered and saved $1000 between them (a tough goal in 1953), the requirement stipulated by the parents..
Charlene tried to balance her college classes with motherhood, and that slowed her progress toward a degree in Education..
Her faith in Christ was always at the forefront of her motives, love, counsel and support of her husband, as well as ways to nurture and encourage children ...her own and others..
Her son and two daughters are avid readers, largely because Charlene read so many books to them while encouraging them to read on their own..
Beyond her home, Charlene mentored countless young women, wives and mothers according to scripture's admonition for older women to mentor younger ones according to the Bible's instruction on relationships, marriage, abortion, children and much more..
Her knowledge and use of scripture allowed her to lead devotionals when asked, as with the "Morton Sisterhood," a unique gathering of some 29 female descendants and in-laws of Ed & Theodosia Morton..
In return, Charlene was and is treasured by her husband and almost a countless host of relatives and friends..
Charlene is survived by her husband, Gordon, Sister Diane Kleypas & husband Jim of San Antonio, Sister Marilyn Cluck & husband Bob of Abilene, Brother Jim Morton & wife Pat of Waco, Daughter Sharon Lathrop & husband Phil of Richardson, Daughter Karen Walthall of Crosby, Texas, Son Bruce Graham & wife Linda of Dallas, Grandson, Graham Lathrop & wife Erika of Menlo Park, CA, Granddaughter Charlotte Mims & husband Kevin of Dallas, Grandson Dustin Walthall & wife Jenni of Bedford, Grandson Alex Walthall & wife Brittany of Little Elm, Granddaughter Krysta Trippel & husband Elliott of Houston, Granddaughters Shannon, Kristen & Julia Graham of Dallas, Great Grandchildren Connor, Lauren & Ryan Mims, Nathan, Haddie & Taylor Walthall, Theodora Lathrop, Owen James Trippel..

The world lost a beloved mother, Mary Hyden Mann Hunter, 68, suddenly, on Friday, October 29, 2021, in Canyon Lake, Texas..
Hyden's greatest love was her family, and all her children were so proud to call her mom..
Hyden was also a member of the Historic Waco Foundation and The Daughters of the Republic of Texas..
Whether you called her Mary Hyden, Hyden, Mimi, or mom, she was the best of the best to all she knew..
The light of her life were her children and grandchildren, and they already miss their "Mimi" so much..
Her children cherish the memories of picking blackberries, scratches and all, and helping mom can preserves, chasing random fires when we saw smoke, rolling down the ramp at the Y in office chairs, trips to the beach, late night talks on the porch, weddings and births, and so many more memories..
John 11:25

She was preceded in death by her son, Robert Aigner Hunter; mother, Mary Louise Mann; father, Robert Allen Mann; and son-in-law, Adam Blake Therrell, Sr..
She is survived by her children; daughter, Julia Barclay Hunter Therrell, of Dallas; son, George Bender Hunter, Sr., and wife, Arundel, of Dallas; brothers, David Wake Mann and wife, Jackie, of Waco, and Allen Barclay Mann and wife, Teitsa of Dallas; grandchildren, Caroline Elizabeth Therrell, Adam Blake Therrell, Jr. (AJ), George Bender Hunter, Jr. (Ben), and Eleanor Blythe Hunter, all of Dallas; former husband, Joe Aigner Hunter; mother-in-law, Mary Frances Hunter; nieces, Jennifer Katherine Mann of Dallas, and Rebecca Mann Wright and husband, Lance of Waco; nephews, David Perry Mann, II and wife, Megan of Denver, Colorado; and Patrick Barclay Mann, Robert Stratton Mann, and Hayden Delozier Mann, all of Dallas..
She is also survived by her great-nieces and great-nephews, relatives and extended family, her YMCA family, as well as many other great friends and all those who were blessed to have known her..
We love you mommy to the moon and back times infinity squared..
Honorary pallbearers are her grandsons, Adam Blake Therrell, Jr. (AJ) and George Bender Hunter, Jr. (Ben)..

Connie Opperman was a loving mother, aunt, grandmother, friend, and devoted follower of Christ..
As the youngest of four girls, she was often seen as a tomboy which served her well later in life when she spent many afternoons bug collecting with her grandson and adding rocks to the collection they started together..
She was a talented seamstress, even making her oldest daughter's junior prom dress..
Her granddaughters remember her by the beautiful hair bows she often made them and her daughters are left with a collection of handmade dolls she made just for them throughout their childhood..
She moved to Denver at the age of 15, taking a job as a live-in nanny to support herself in her parents absence..
In her retirement she lived in Louisiana and Texas to be closer to her daughters..
Connie is preceded in death by her parents, Walter and Evelyn Maxine and her sisters Joanne and Kathryn..
She is survived by Dennis Cuypers, her sister Susan, her Daughters Megan and Mara, her nieces Melissa and Kelly, and her grandchildren Gavin, Audra, and Vera..
